publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: An easy method to know the causes and signs of the humour most ruleth in the body : and to avoid thereby things hurtful: as also to enable men to give better account of the state of their bodies, when they are diseased to the physitian, and not hazard the lives of themselves and their freinds by only urging him to prophesy (and that often falsily) the disease by onely the inspection of vrine
monogr.author: La Framboisière, Nicolas Abraham de

div.head: POSTSCRIPT.
div.p: I Have by me a farre larger Tract on this subject, but this being more easy for common capacities, I thought fit to present it first 〈◊〉 view; As this shall finde acceptance, and I encouragement, I shall send to light matters of greater moment than these.
Farewell. That I may not seem to be a plagiary, the Author in Latine is Frambesarius.
